title: Do you think a person is more attractive with glasses on? - Quora

response.answer_text: A2A “Does wearing glasses makes you look cuter?” Eh, maybe? I wear prescription-less glasses sometimes, used to wear them a lot when I was a supervisor and really just liked them personally how they fit my face and liked their more unique appearance versus other people who wore glasses. I also never lied about them either, if someone asked me “You near-sighted or far-sighted?” I wouldn’t answer and I would just hand them my glasses for them to try and on and they would look off in the distance and look at it through my glasses and without and I would get people being like “Oh, Near-sighted.” or “Slightly far-sighted I see.” I wouldn’t correct them, just take my glasses back and put them back on. It also helped with some confrontational situations as per my job risks as some people are less likely to strike at a man wearing glasses than a man without. But overall, I just liked how they looked and fit and gave my face an additional feature. Plus my sarcastic, unimpressed look really does have more impact when I am looking at someone above my glasses with the slight head tilt.

I once met this guy on Tinder whose bio said: Looking for my trap queen. I couldn’t help but laugh really hard, and I had to swipe right. His name is Mitch, and he recently graduated with his MBA, and is out there on the prowl. After getting to know him through his Snapchats, I can tell you that he’s totally this super nerdy bookworm, and loves to hang out with his other nerdy looking friends ALL the time. It’s adorable as hell. I also think he’s generally pretty handsome, and has these really nice pair of blue eyes that go well with his brown hair and light skin. One day, he sponatanouely sent me a pic of him wearing his reading glasses while dressed in a suit and tie, and omg…..I melted. He had sent me another one later on that day, but this time without his glasses on. His caption read, ” uhh, is everything okay dear?” (Oops, I didn’t reply to the first pic.) I legit thought about him in glasses for hours! He was so fucking cute, it made my day. Heh heh I replied to him saying, “ everything is okay. I’m fine! I’m good….. Actually… I’m really good….Oh shit, what am I saying? I’m doing pretty fantastic!” :D

While there is a certain allure to a girl with glasses on, especially when they match a certain shy demeanor, I wouldn’t say it makes them more attractive. Those I’ve found attractive were so in their own right. It’s something of a prop, even when used on a strictly practical basis, so they stand out. I honestly prefer when a woman does need eyewear, that she primarily uses contacts and breaks out the frames on occasion. It just sort of keeps things interesting as they tend to behave a little more shy with frames and you have to be more careful with kissing. (Plus, gently taking her glasses off for longer sessions is kinda hot.) But I do generally prefer good vision or contacts so her pretty eyes aren’t obstructed. Guy or girl, though. There’s no recovery from frames that don’t flatter you… And then there’s “Problem Glasses.”  Let’s just say myself and the staple of SJWs don’t mix too well; on any level.

Does wearing glasses makes you look cuter? Unfortunately, that’s a subjective question and one that depends totally upon any person’s personal preference. For myself, wearing my half-inch thick Coca-Cola bottle glasses did nothing for my appearance, and cute wasn’t a word I ever heard in conjunction with my appearance in them. However, I was far more worried about being able to see than being cute, so there’s that. Some people look better with glasses, some without, but that’s just how I see things.

Many people who wear glasses are not choosing the right ones for their face type. So they are not looking good. But if the face shape is correct for the glasses to type the person is wearing than I would say yes. There is this cool website, I forgot the name, was something like glassesusa and there you can just upload your photo and try on the glasses and then order them at a good price. Also before that, I would recommend taking a look at some guide which advises you which glasses you might want to get for the face shape which you have.

Absolutely not. However, many guys seem to have a weird fetish for girls with glasses. I wear glasses. Because I have bad eyesight. Not as a trend. I also wore contact lenses for years so no one knew. And then stopped bothering with them after a while. No I’m not attracted to guys with glasses. And I’m glad my guy has perfect eyesight. If we ever have kids there’s less chance of them being myopic and developing astigmatism. Yay. Why anyone would find bad eyesight (essentially a deformity) attractive is beyond me.

You’re asking this question as though it has an objective answer. However, what is or isn’t “attractive” is subjective. Glasses can make a person more attractive to people who think glasses look attractive. It’s basically that simple. To add a little bit more nuance, though: I think that, for every person, there’s probably at least one “magic pair” of glasses that just suits them very well. But most pairs won’t quite be “the one.” Part of it is how they look to an observer, but part of it is also how the wearer feels about them. Some people are more comfortable with a low-key, professional style. Others like something with more flair or even a bit of a wacky vibe. When a person is wearing something they like, other people will pick up on their confidence.

For me wearing glasses definitely makes me cuter. The trick is in getting the right frame and color that complements your outfit. Check out this post on how to pick matching frames for your skin color and style. Shopping on glasses can be trick so consider going for a neutral color if you don't have the budget to buy multiple colors of different eyeglasses. I hope this helps.

It depends on whether or not the glasses fits their face, and the style of the glasses. Glasses look different on different people, and the very style of them can really down someone’s appearance. I say just really get a second or third opinion if you want to or need to wear glasses. Just take your time shopping around for the right style and pair that will go well with your face.

If someone is put off by another wearing glasses I would be concerned that this person was a titchy bit shallow. Just my own view of course. I don't think that looks are the most important aspect of a person anyway.

No, but they help me see just how much of an idiot someone would be for thinking that glasses make a person more or less attractive. When I wear my other pair I can see and read either the computer or books!

Yes a perfect pair of glasses can really make a person look cuter. But it’s not really an accessory, more of an instrument used for those who need them. But it doesn’t encourage those with those disabilities to class their spectacles.
